title: hello there!
text:
hello there!


Thanks for stopping by! I am a data visualization engineer who specializes in human-centered, accessible development in R Shiny and Quarto. Programming in R is my favorite thing (aside from my lovely children, husband, and hoofed friends). I also like chess, puzzles, and Avatar the Last Airbender.



    
        
        
        
    
    
        Skills
        Education
        Experience
        Talks
    





  
  
    
    
        
            
                Programming
                Data Viz & UX
                Research & Data Sci
                Leadership
            
        
        
            
        
    

 
  
  

  
   
  Degrees
   
  2008 – 2011 
  University of Kansas 
  BA, Psychology + Art   
  
  2012 – 2015 
  Washington Univ. in St. Louis 
  Master of Public Health   
  
  2012 – 2015 
  Washington Univ. in St. Louis 
  Master of Social Work  
  
  
  Relevant Training
   
  Data Science with R   
  Programming and Applied Statistics in R   
  Programming in R   
  R Best Practices   
  Machine Learning with TidyModels   
  Reporting with Quarto   
  An Introduction to SQL with R   
  Package Development   
  Version Control Using Git & GitHub      
  

  

  
   Director, Business Intelligence | ASTHO  
  I oversee ASTHO’s business intelligence planning and products (dashboards, data visualizations, data storytelling) and support the organization's use of data to inform
  decision making. One of my team’s flagship products is the Profile dashboard, which has received recognition for its modern design and useability. In addition to
  supporting ASTHO’s internal business intelligence needs, my team provides data services to partner organizations in dashboarding and data visualization. I am ASTHO's
  subject matter expert in R programming, interactive data visualization and data storytelling, and custom dashboard development. 
  
  
   Previous  
  Research Project Director | University of Kansas 
  
  Project Manager | NC State University
  
  Project Manager | NC State University
  
  Research Scholar | Washington University in Saint Louis
  

  
  Tailoring Shiny for Modern Users 
  ShinyConf 2024  
  My talk at ShinyConf was attended by ~400 participants and focused on UI and UX in shiny app development. My slides are available here. After the presentation, my work was featured on Eric Nantz's podcast, R Weekly Highlights. Check it out starting around 19:30.
  
  
  
  What is Business Intelligence? 
  May 2024  
  I gave a talk to 350 staff on business intelligence - what is it and how do we get there? More on this in my projects!
  
  
  
  The State of Public Health Workforce 
  April 2024  
  A presentation given to state and territorial health agency workforce and HR directors. Slides here.

title: Building Capacity for Data Visualization
text: This effort has just started – but the objective is to develop a shiny application (based on the rendering below) that leverages my {astho.viz} package for data visualization. The goal is to build capacity at my organization for more people to easily develop interactive and static data visualizations that use a consistent style and theme and contain key accessibility features

title: The Governor’s Council on Tax Reform
text: Below are a few examples of the report. The full report is available here.

title: What is Business Intelligence?
text:
Business intelligence is strategically using data to inform decision making.

 

Step 1: Coordinated data collection and documented datasets


 

Step 2: Integrated and centrally housed datasets


   

Step 3: Key metrics that are used to answer operations and program questions

      

Step 4a: Use data science and analytics to uncover insights and predict needs

      

Step 4b: Use data science and analytics to uncover insights and predict needs

      

Step 5: Automated reports and dashboards that make insights accessible

title: Profile Data Stories
text: We have added stories to our data application to connect data to action. Check out one of them below. They are available at www.astho.org/profile.

title: The Profile Dashboard
text: We are now underway to make this app align with WCAG 2.2 compliance and are trilled to further build out its accessibility.
